info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued January 09 at 6:05AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Forest Service Sawtooth Avalanche Center in Ketchum has ISSUED a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH which is in effect until 4 AM MST Wednesday... * WHAT...The avalanche danger is expected to rise to HIGH by Wednesday. Backcountry avalanche warnings may follow. * WHERE...The White Cloud, Smoky, Boulder, Pioneer, and the southern Salmon River Mountains including the mountains surrounding Galena Summit, Banner Summit, and the mountains east of Stanley. The backcountry avalanche watch does not apply to highway avalanche programs or operating ski areas. * WHEN...Until 4 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...An intense winter storm bringing heavy snowfall and strong wind will overload a very weak snowpack. Very dangerous avalanche conditions are expected to develop by Wednesday. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Very dangerous avalanche conditions are developing. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Stay off of and out from below steep slopes-slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. Avalanches may be triggered remotely-from flat terrain above, below, and to the sides of steeps slopes. Natural and human- triggered avalanches may run long distances and can impact gentler terrain below. Consult www.sawtoothavalanche.com or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
